publicationStmt.authority: The Estate of Virginia Woolf, administered by the Society of Authors

handNote.p: Holograph writing by the documents' main hand, Virginia Woolf

msIdentifier.repository: Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature

physDesc.p: Anon. Typescript fragment, with the author's ms. correction on p. 3, unsigned and undated. 9p. Wanting p. 1. Paginated 2-10.

correction.p: Apparent errors have been explicitly corrected in / tags, wrapped in a element.

normalization.p: Where appropriate, spelling and punctuation have been modernised using / tags, wrapped in a element.

interpretation.p: Names and references to places and literary works have been wrapped in tags which link to annotations and secondary material.

projectDesc.p: Text encoded as part of 'The Digital "Anon": A Digital Genetic Edition of Virginia Woolf's Final Essays'. This project, funded by Leverhulme Grant ECF-2022-602, seeks to construct a TEI-XML based digital edition of the drafts of 'Anon' and 'The Reader', among the final documents Woolf wrote before her death.

p.l: Anon.
common voice singing out of doors. he has no house. He lives

a roaming life, crossing the fields,
moutning mounting the hills,

and lying down by the hawthown to listen to
te the nightingale.

Still, by shutting out a
chimey chimney or a bungalow
we can see what Anon saw-- the bird haunted reed whispering
fen, the down, and the green scar never healed along which

he came when he made his journeys. He was a
simp le simple singer,

lifting a song or a story from other peoples lips, and
lettig letting

the
auience audience join in the
chours chorus . Sometimes he made a few

lines that exactly
matchedhis matched his
emtoin emotion --he was an
arist artist .
But there is no name to that song.

When at last the house was built, he
song sung only at the
back door. Upstairs they spoke French; his song was sung
in English; and the words were so uncouth

that they
n ed need a
ditioc nary dictionary now.

Bu But to the listener then, to Harrison for
xample example in his
pasronage parsonage , they were not only difficult. They were painful.
They reminded him of his lack of intellectual

His intellectual pedigree reached
vack back only to Gower

Langland, Chaucer, a bare
hundre hundred and fifty years.

To have
anscestors ancestors he must
ross cross the channel. His ancestors

by way of the mind are Greeks and
Rla ns Romans . His page is
